strings.Value: "I'm nobody's minion."
"Fallen friends? What happened here?"
"The Knurly Witch sent me to help you."
"I'm here for the crown. Hand it over."
[Attack] "Time to chop some wood!"
"I'm just passing through."
"I'm sorry for your loss."
"Why did the Wriggling Man try to steal the crown?"
"If you hate the crown so much, let me take it to the witch."
"I can't let you return the crown to the Knurly Witch."
"I'll leave you to it, then."
[Use detect magic]

{n}The forest here looks blasted apart by a meteorite, complete with fallen trees and a crater at its center. Surrounding the crater are several huge, twisted trees. Suddenly the trees turn to look at you, and a jagged maw opens in one of the trunks. With a voice like creaking wood, the treant says,{/n} "Who disturbs the prayers to our fallen friends? More of the {d|Wriggling}Wriggling Man's{/d} obscene minions?"
"Then you are not our concern. Leave this place and let us mourn our dead."

"The Wriggling Man happened."{n} The treant's words are slow and sad. {/n}"In his attempt to steal the First Crown from our mistress, he broke it. The magic blasted apart this grove — you stand among the corpses of our beloved trees. We must pray for the healing of this place, then return this hateful crown to its rightful owner, the {d|Knurly}Knurly Witch{/d}."
{n}The treant glowers.{/n} "The First Crown rightfully belongs to the Knurly Witch! Your writhing master will never touch it again!"
"Then pass and begone."{n} The treant turns back to its quiet contemplation of the pit.{/n}
{n}The treant ponders this for several moments. At last, he says,{/n} "That is wise. You could take the crown to the Knurly Witch for us, while we comfort the grieving forest."
{n}The treant frowns.{/n} "You are not of the witch's brood. You are a rot — an infestation. We will cut you out."
"As we are." {n}The treant turns back to his prayers.{/n}

"Why does the Wriggling Man do anything? Because he's a vile, disgusting creature who seeks to rob our mistress of her place at the Nymph Queen's side. He is the rot in the wood. A weed to be pulled. The larvae that devour a forest. The Knurly Witch will cure Thousandbreaths of his sickness."
"Then you must be pruned. Your bones will fertilize our forest."
"Poor things! They mourn their burned tree friends so much!"
"Talking logs mourn the silent ones, hmm? Heh heh! Hey, stump, wanna see a magic trick? One snap of my fingers, and I'll make a bunch of bushes disappear!"
"Forest's wounds heal easily. Much harder healing the soul of one who has lost their loved ones."
